review_title: Great way to network and get involved
job_title: Student Representative in Los Angeles, CA
pros: You meet with many of the students, staff, faculty, and administration on campus. This allows for you to network, learn how your campus works ,and what it has to offer.
cons: A lot of work is involved during all hours of the day. Also, managing a position in Associated Student as a student takes a lot of balancing.

review_title: Best Part-Time Job for Full-Time Students
job_title: Student Assistant (A S Student Government) in San Jose, CA
pros:
- Staff is very kind and understanding. They understand that during midterms and finals you might need time off. 
- If you've completed all your assigned tasks, you can do your homework.
- Skills are very applicable to any full-time job, especially organization, customer service, managing a front desk, minute-taking, and multi-tasking. You could easily translate the experience to an office assistant role. 
- You learn a lot about the different resources on campus, sometimes ones that you never knew about before. 
- The office functions on the school's schedule, so you're not required to work on Spring Break, Winter Break, etc. but you still have the option. 
- Opportunities to go to workshops that benefit your career. I was able to attend a workshop about LinkedIn during my work time.
- Sometimes you get free leftover food from events going on in the SU.
cons: - There may be times where you're alone in the office. Maybe it was just one single experience that I had, but some sketchy people frequent the SU and wander inside.

pros: I got to develop as a leader.  I learned my strengths and how to advocate for my community. There were several opportunities for me to take on different roles that helped me develop soft skills
cons: The job did not pay much, and we only got paid through stipends.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: accessible,good experience to students,friendly,obedient to work,
cons: It would be a part-time work for students, which has less importance in the resume.

review_title: Great place to work and learn
job_title: IT Support Specialist in San Jose, CA
pros: Flexible timings, supportive manager, managed by students

job_title: Web Developer in San Jose, CA
pros: decent pay, good culture, flexible timings
